meanings.sent1: The telltale signs of autumn were the colorful leaves falling from the trees.
meanings.sent2: Her telltale blush gave away her embarrassment.
meanings.sent3: The telltale smell of burnt popcorn filled the room, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The telltale sound of distant thunder warned of an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The telltale paw prints in the mud showed that the dog had been digging in the garden.

meanings.definition: a person or thing that reveals or indicates something
meanings.sent1: The detective was a telltale who always uncovered the truth.
meanings.sent2: The leaky faucet was a telltale of the plumbing issues in the house.
meanings.sent3: The telltale mirror reflected the hidden entrance to the secret room.
meanings.sent4: The old compass was a telltale of the shipwreck that happened years ago.
meanings.sent5: The telltale alarm clock woke him up every morning without fail.

meanings.definition: a visible sign or indication of something
meanings.sent1: The telltale smoke rising from the chimney signaled that dinner was ready.
meanings.sent2: The telltale crack in the wall hinted at a structural problem in the building.
meanings.sent3: The telltale shadow on the ground revealed the presence of a hidden figure.
meanings.sent4: The telltale chirping of birds at dawn marked the beginning of a new day.
meanings.sent5: The telltale scent of fresh bread wafted from the bakery down the street.
